intro: Amauropelta furfuracea, commonly known as the hairy shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. Its leaves are typically dark green and can grow up to several feet in length. Amauropelta furfuracea thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
